description: Indicates the availability of paper in all trays.
interpretation: A value of 0 indicates that there is no paper in any of the trays. A value of 1 means that paper is available in at least one tray.
troubleshootingSteps: If the value is 0, check each tray and load paper where required.
Verify that the printer correctly detects tray paper levels and that any tray‑specific sensors are functioning.
If paper is present but the value remains 0, inspect for sensor faults, incorrect tray configuration, or firmware issues.
After resolving paper shortages or sensor problems, confirm that the metric changes to 1 on the next poll.

description: Indicates the status of the toner with respect to its capacity.
interpretation: A value of 0 indicates that toner capacity is low. A value of 1 indicates that there is adequate toner in the printer.
troubleshootingSteps: When the value is 0, plan to replace or refill the toner cartridge before print quality degrades or printing stops.
Check printer status pages or the control panel for more precise toner level readings and any related warnings.
Ensure that genuine or supported toner cartridges are used so that capacity sensing works reliably.
After replacing toner, verify that the printer reports adequate capacity and that the metric returns to 1.

description: Indicates whether a toner is available for printing or not.
interpretation: A value of 0 indicates that either the toner cartridge is not physically present in the printer or the printer is out of toner. A value of 1 confirms that the toner cartridge is physically present and available for printing.
troubleshootingSteps: If the value is 0, first verify that a toner cartridge is installed correctly and is not empty.
Inspect the printer for messages about missing or depleted toner and follow the manufacturer’s replacement procedure.
Check for protective seals or packaging left on a newly installed cartridge that might prevent detection.
Once the cartridge is properly installed and has toner, confirm that the metric switches to 1.

description: Indicates whether the flow of paper into and out of the printer is smooth.
interpretation: A value of 0 indicates that there is a paper jam. A value of 1 indicates that paper flow is smooth.
troubleshootingSteps: When the value is 0, follow the printer’s jam‑clear instructions to remove any stuck paper from all accessible paths.
Check rollers and feed components for wear, debris, or damage that could cause recurring jams.
Verify that the correct media type and size are loaded and that trays and guides are adjusted properly.
After clearing jams and adjusting hardware, confirm that the metric returns to 1 during normal printing.

description: Indicates whether the printer is online or offline.
interpretation: A value of 0 indicates that the printer is offline. A value of 1 denotes that the printer is online.
troubleshootingSteps: If the value is 0, check the printer control panel to ensure it is not manually set to offline or paused.
Verify network connectivity, IP configuration, and that the printer responds to ping or SNMP if applicable.
Review print server or spooler status to ensure the queue and port are not disabled or misconfigured.
After restoring connectivity and online status, confirm that the measure reports 1 and print jobs succeed.

description: Indicates the overall status of the doors/covers present in the printer. Available only for printers with doors/covers.
interpretation: A value of 0 indicates that one or more doors/covers are open. A value of 1 indicates that all doors/covers are closed.
troubleshootingSteps: If the value is 0, inspect all printer doors and covers (front, rear, side, cartridge access, duplex unit) and close them securely.
Check for broken or misaligned door sensors or latches that may falsely report an open state.
Review the printer’s status display for specific guidance on which door or cover is open.
Once all doors are properly closed and any hardware issues corrected, verify that the metric changes to 1.
